summary: This is a brief email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach, Florida, expressing disbelief that lawyers involved with Jeffrey Epstein have remained quiet for so long. It is addressed to Alex Acosta, who was the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida at the time.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: The email is addressed to Alex Acosta, who was the U.S. Attorney overseeing the Epstein case in Florida at the time.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email inquiry, referencing the ongoing case or investigation involving him.

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, was the lead federal prosecutor overseeing the investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations.context: Office address of the Assistant U.S. Attorney sending the email.

keyFacts: The email is dated December 6, 2007, during the period of the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The sender, an Assistant U.S. Attorney, expresses surprise that lawyers involved with Epstein have remained quiet.
The email is addressed to Alex Acosta, highlighting his central role in the federal prosecution decisions regarding Epstein.
